api:field.name: abstract
api:field.api:text:
<jats:p> <jats:bold>Abstract</jats:bold> ; Electrical stimulation of the medial forebrain bundle
increases <jats:sup>32</jats:sup>P incorporation into striatal tyrosine hydroxylase (TH)
at Ser <jats:sup>19</jats:sup>, Ser<jats:sup>31</jats:sup>, and Ser<jats:sup>40</jats:sup>. In the present
studies, the effects of acute haloperidol and related drugs on sitespecific TH
phosphorylation stoichiometry (PS) in the nigrostriatal and mesolimbic systems
were determined by quantitative blot immunolabeling using phosphorylation
statespecific antibodies. The striatum (Str), substantia nigra (SN), nucleus
accumbens (NAc), and ventral tegmental area (VTA) from Sprague‐Dawley rats
were harvested 30‐40 min after a single injection of either vehicle,
haloperidol (2 mg/kg), raclopride (2 mg/kg), clozapine (30 mg/kg), or SCH23390
(0.5 mg/kg). In vehicle‐injected control rats, Ser<jats:sup>19</jats:sup> PS was 1.5‐ to
2.5‐fold lower in Str and NAc than in SN and VTA, Ser<jats:sup>31</jats:sup> PS was
two‐to fourfold higher in Str and NAc than in SN and VTA, and Ser<jats:sup>40</jats:sup>
PS was similar between the terminal field and cell body regions. After
haloperidol, Ser<jats:sup>40</jats:sup> PS increased twofold in Str and NAc, whereas a
smaller increase in SN and VTA was observed. The effects of haloperidol on
Ser<jats:sup>19</jats:sup> PS were similar to those on Ser<jats:sup>40</jats:sup> in each region ;
however, haloperidol treatment increased Ser<jats:sup>31</jats:sup> PS at least 1.6‐fold in all regions. The effects of raclopride on TH PS were comparable to those of haloperidol, whereas clozapine treatment increased TH PS at all sites in all regions. By contrast, the effects of SCH23390 on TH PS were relatively small and restricted to the NAc. The stoichiometries of site‐specific TH phosphorylation in vivo are presented for the first time. The nigrostriatal and mesolimbic systems have common features of TH PS, distinguished by differences in TH PS between the terminal field and cell body regions and by dissimilar increases in TH PS in the terminal field and cell body regions after acute haloperidol.</jats:p>

api:field.name: title
api:field.api:text: Stoichiometry of Tyrosine Hydroxylase Phosphorylation in the Nigrostriatal and Mesolimbic Systems In Vivo

api:field.name: abstract
api:field.api:text: Electrical stimulation of the medial forebrain bundle increases 32P incorporation into striatal tyrosine hydroxylase (TH) at Ser19, Ser31, and Ser40. In the present studies, the effects of acute haloperidol and related drugs on site-specific TH phosphorylation stoichiometry (PS) in the nigrostriatal and mesolimbic systems were determined by quantitative blot immunolabeling using phosphorylation state-specific antibodies. The striatum (Str), substantia nigra (SN), nucleus accumbens (NAc), and ventral tegmental area (VTA) from Sprague-Dawley rats were harvested 30-40 min after a single injection of either vehicle, haloperidol (2 mg/kg), raclopride (2 mg/kg), clozapine (30 mg/kg), or SCH23390 (0.5 mg/kg). In vehicle-injected control rats, Ser19 PS was 1.5- to 2.5-fold lower in Str and NAc than in SN and VTA, Ser31 PS was two- to fourfold higher in Str and NAc than in SN and VTA, and Ser40 PS was similar between the terminal field and cell body regions. After haloperidol, Ser40 PS increased twofold in Str and NAc, whereas a smaller increase in SN and VTA was observed. The effects of haloperidol on Ser19 PS were similar to those on Ser40 in each region; however, haloperidol treatment increased Ser31 PS at least 1.6-fold in all regions. The effects of raclopride on TH PS were comparable to those of haloperidol, whereas clozapine treatment increased TH PS at all sites in all regions. By contrast, the effects of SCH23390 on TH PS were relatively small and restricted to the NAc. The stoichiometries of site-specific TH phosphorylation in vivo are presented for the first time. The nigrostriatal and mesolimbic systems have common features of TH PS, distinguished by differences in TH PS between the terminal field and cell body regions and by dissimilar increases in TH PS in the terminal field and cell body regions after acute haloperidol.

api:field.name: title
api:field.api:text: Stoichiometry of tyrosine hydroxylase phosphorylation in the nigrostriatal and mesolimbic systems in vivo: Effects of acute haloperidol and related compounds

api:field.name: abstract
api:field.api:text: Electrical stimulation of the medial forebrain bundle increases (32)P incorporation into striatal tyrosine hydroxylase (TH) at Ser (19), Ser(31), and Ser(40). In the present studies, the effects of acute haloperidol and related drugs on sitespecific TH phosphorylation stoichiometry (PS) in the nigrostriatal and mesolimbic systems were determined by quantitative blot immunolabeling using phosphorylation statespecific antibodies. The striatum (Str), substantia nigra (SN), nucleus accumbens (NAc), and ventral tegmental area (VTA) from Sprague-Dawley rats were harvested 30-40 min after a single injection of either vehicle, haloperidol (2 mg/kg), raclopride (2 mg/kg), clozapine (30 mg/kg), or SCH23390 (0.5 mg/kg). In vehicle-injected control rats, Ser(19) PS was 1.5- to 2. 5-fold lower in Str and NAc than in SN and VTA, Ser(31) PS was two-to fourfold higher in Str and NAc than in SN and VTA, and Ser(40) PS was similar between the terminal field and cell body regions. After haloperidol, Ser(40) PS increased twofold in Str and NAc, whereas a smaller increase in SN and VTA was observed. The effects of haloperidol on Ser(19) PS were similar to those on Ser(40) in each region; however, haloperidol treatment increased Ser(31) PS at least 1.6-fold in all regions. The effects of raclopride on TH PS were comparable to those of haloperidol, whereas clozapine treatment increased TH PS at all sites in all regions. By contrast, the effects of SCH23390 on TH PS were relatively small and restricted to the NAc. The stoichiometries of site-specific TH phosphorylation in vivo are presented for the first time. The nigrostriatal and mesolimbic systems have common features of TH PS, distinguished by differences in TH PS between the terminal field and cell body regions and by dissimilar increases in TH PS in the terminal field and cell body regions after acute haloperidol.

api:address.api:line: Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology and Neuroscience Center of Excellence, Louisiana State University Health Sciences Center, New Orleans, Louisiana, USA. msalva@lsumc.edu

api:field.name: title
api:field.api:text: Stoichiometry of tyrosine hydroxylase phosphorylation in the nigrostriatal and mesolimbic systems in vivo: effects of acute haloperidol and related compounds.

api:field.name: abstract
api:field.api:text: Electrical stimulation of the medial forebrain bundle increases (32)P incorporation into striatal tyrosine hydroxylase (TH) at Ser (19), Ser(31), and Ser(40). In the present studies, the effects of acute haloperidol and related drugs on sitespecific TH phosphorylation stoichiometry (PS) in the nigrostriatal and mesolimbic systems were determined by quantitative blot immunolabeling using phosphorylation statespecific antibodies. The effects of raclopride on TH PS were comparable to those of haloperidol, whereas clozapine treatment increased TH PS at all sites in all regions. By contrast, the effects of SCH23390 on TH PS were relatively small and restricted to the NAc. The stoichiometries of site-specific TH phosphorylation in vivo are presented for the first time. The nigrostriatal and mesolimbic systems have common features of TH PS, distinguished by differences in TH PS between the terminal field and cell body regions and by dissimilar increases in TH PS in the terminal field and cell body regions after acute haloperidol.
